meanings.definition: To treat or coat (a metal) in order to reduce its chemical reactivity
meanings.sent1: The mechanic is passivating the metal parts to make them less likely to rust.
meanings.sent2: After passivating the steel, it became more resistant to corrosion.
meanings.sent3: Passivating the metal felt like giving it a protective shield against harmful substances.
meanings.sent4: She passivated the metal as if she was casting a spell to ward off chemical reactions.
meanings.sent5: Passivating the metal is like putting on armor to defend against the elements.

meanings.sent1: The child passivated after playing outside all day, sitting quietly in the shade.
meanings.sent2: As the sun set, the city passivated, with people heading home for the night.
meanings.sent3: The cat passivated lazily on the windowsill, enjoying the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent4: After a long day of work, he passivated on the couch, too tired to move.
meanings.sent5: The computer passivated into sleep mode, conserving energy when not in use.

meanings.definition: The process of forming a protective oxide layer on a metal surface
meanings.sent1: The passivating of the metal surface prevented it from reacting with the environment.
meanings.sent2: During the passivating of the steel, a thin layer of oxide formed on its surface.
meanings.sent3: The passivating of the metal surface was like giving it a shield against harm.
meanings.sent4: The passivating of the metal surface was a silent guardian, protecting it from harm.
meanings.sent5: Passivating the metal surface was like putting on a coat to shield it from harm.
